definition: writing style in which the main subject is approached directly from the outset/opposite of 冒題|冒题[mao4 ti2]
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: This is the first time (that) I've acted on the stage.
sentences.chinese: 登臺演戲我還是破題兒第一遭。

sentences.english: It's certainly the first time I've had an assignment of that kind.
sentences.chinese: 我幹這樣的差使確實也是破題兒第一遭。

sentences.english: The layout become the key to overcome the difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 佈局成爲此次破題的關鍵。

definition: my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
third and fourth lines (in an eight-line poem) which form a couplet
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
